content:
TITLE: Basic Usage of Synchronous Retell Client
DESCRIPTION: Example demonstrating how to initialize the Retell client with an API key and create an agent with LLM-based response engine and a specific voice.
SOURCE: https://github.com/retellai/retell-python-sdk/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-20_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from retell import Retell

client = Retell(
    api_key="YOUR_RETELL_API_KEY",
)

agent_response = client.agent.create(
    response_engine={
        "llm_id": "llm_234sdertfsdsfsdf",
        "type": "retell-llm",
    },
    voice_id="11labs-Adrian",
)
print(agent_response.agent_id)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Asynchronous Usage of Retell Client
DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to use the async version of the Retell client. It demonstrates initializing the AsyncRetell client and making asynchronous API calls using await.
SOURCE: https://github.com/retellai/retell-python-sdk/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-20_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
import asyncio
from retell import AsyncRetell

client = AsyncRetell(
    api_key="YOUR_RETELL_API_KEY",
)


async def main() -> None:
    agent_response = await client.agent.create(
        response_engine={
            "llm_id": "llm_234sdertfsdsfsdf",
            "type": "retell-llm",
        },
        voice_id="11labs-Adrian",
    )
    print(agent_response.agent_id)


asyncio.run(main())
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Error Handling with Retell Client
DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to handle various API errors with the Retell client. It demonstrates catching specific error types like APIConnectionError, RateLimitError, and APIStatusError, along with accessing error details.
SOURCE: https://github.com/retellai/retell-python-sdk/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-20_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
import retell
from retell import Retell

client = Retell()

try:
    client.agent.create(
        response_engine={
            "llm_id": "llm_234sdertfsdsfsdf",
            "type": "retell-llm",
        },
        voice_id="11labs-Adrian",
    )
except retell.APIConnectionError as e:
    print("The server could not be reached")
    print(e.__cause__)  # an underlying Exception, likely raised within httpx.
except retell.RateLimitError as e:
    print("A 429 status code was received; we should back off a bit.")
except retell.APIStatusError as e:
    print("Another non-200-range status code was received")
    print(e.status_code)
    print(e.response)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using Nested Parameters with Retell Client
DESCRIPTION: Example of using nested parameters with the Retell client. It shows how to use TypedDict for structured filtering of call listings with various criteria like agent_id, call status, and timestamps.
SOURCE: https://github.com/retellai/retell-python-sdk/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-20_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from retell import Retell

client = Retell()

call_responses = client.call.list(
    filter_criteria={
        "agent_id": ["agent_oBeDLoLOeuAbiuaMFXRtDOLriT12345"],
        "call_status": ["ended"],
        "call_successful": [True],
        "call_type": ["phone_call"],
        "direction": ["inbound"],
        "disconnection_reason": ["user_hangup"],
        "duration_ms": {
            "lower_threshold": 0,
            "upper_threshold": 0,
        },
        "e2e_latency_p50": {
            "lower_threshold": 0,
            "upper_threshold": 0,
        },
        "from_number": ["string"],
        "in_voicemail": [True],
        "start_timestamp": {
            "lower_threshold": 1738475411000,
            "upper_threshold": 1738475421000,
        },
        "to_number": ["string"],
        "user_sentiment": ["Positive"],
        "version": [0],
    },
)
print(call_responses.filter_criteria)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Timeouts with Retell Client
DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to configure request timeouts for the Retell client. It demonstrates setting a simple timeout duration or using more granular timeout control for different aspects of the request.
SOURCE: https://github.com/retellai/retell-python-sdk/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-20_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from retell import Retell

# Configure the default for all requests:
client = Retell(
    # 20 seconds (default is 1 minute)
    timeout=20.0,
)

# More granular control:
client = Retell(
    timeout=httpx.Timeout(60.0, read=5.0, write=10.0, connect=2.0),
)

# Override per-request:
client.with_options(timeout=5.0).agent.create(
    response_engine={
        "llm_id": "llm_234sdertfsdsfsdf",
        "type": "retell-llm",
    },
    voice_id="11labs-Adrian",
)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Customizing Retell Client on Per-Request Basis in Python
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to use the with_options() method to customize the Retell client for individual requests, allowing for flexible configuration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/retellai/retell-python-sdk/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-20_snippet_13

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
client.with_options(http_client=DefaultHttpxClient(...))
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Retries with Retell Client
DESCRIPTION: Example demonstrating how to configure retry behavior for the Retell client. It shows setting max_retries globally for all requests or per-request basis.
SOURCE: https://github.com/retellai/retell-python-sdk/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-20_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from retell import Retell

# Configure the default for all requests:
client = Retell(
    # default is 2
    max_retries=0,
)

# Or, configure per-request:
client.with_options(max_retries=5).agent.create(
    response_engine={
        "llm_id": "llm_234sdertfsdsfsdf",
        "type": "retell-llm",
    },
    voice_id="11labs-Adrian",
)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Streaming Response Handling with Retell Client
DESCRIPTION: Example demonstrating how to use the streaming response interface to process API responses incrementally, reading the response body only when needed.
SOURCE: https://github.com/retellai/retell-python-sdk/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-20_snippet_10

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
with client.agent.with_streaming_response.create(
    response_engine={
        "llm_id": "llm_234sdertfsdsfsdf",
        "type": "retell-llm",
    },
    voice_id="11labs-Adrian",
) as response:
    print(response.headers.get("X-My-Header"))

    for line in response.iter_lines():
        print(line)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Custom HTTP Client for Retell SDK in Python
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to override the default httpx client in the Retell SDK to customize proxies, transports, and other advanced features. It also shows how to set a custom base URL for the API.
SOURCE: https://github.com/retellai/retell-python-sdk/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-20_snippet_12

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
import httpx
from retell import Retell, DefaultHttpxClient

client = Retell(
    # Or use the `RETELL_BASE_URL` env var
    base_url="http://my.test.server.example.com:8083",
    http_client=DefaultHttpxClient(
        proxy="http://my.test.proxy.example.com",
        transport=httpx.HTTPTransport(local_address="0.0.0.0"),
    ),
)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Managing HTTP Resources with Context Manager in Retell SDK
DESCRIPTION: Illustrates how to use a context manager to automatically close HTTP connections when finished, ensuring proper resource management in the Retell SDK.
SOURCE: https://github.com/retellai/retell-python-sdk/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-20_snippet_14

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from retell import Retell

with Retell() as client:
  # make requests here
  ...

# HTTP client is now closed
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Accessing Raw Response Data with Retell Client
DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to access the raw HTTP response, including headers, when making API calls with the Retell client using the with_raw_response modifier.
SOURCE: https://github.com/retellai/retell-python-sdk/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-20_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from retell import Retell

client = Retell()
response = client.agent.with_raw_response.create(
    response_engine={
        "llm_id": "llm_234sdertfsdsfsdf",
        "type": "retell-llm",
    },
    voice_id="11labs-Adrian",
)
print(response.headers.get('X-My-Header'))

agent = response.parse()  # get the object that `agent.create()` would have returned
print(agent.agent_id)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Making Custom Requests to Undocumented Endpoints
DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to make requests to undocumented API endpoints using the Retell client's HTTP verb methods like post, with client options like retries still being respected.
SOURCE: https://github.com/retellai/retell-python-sdk/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-20_snippet_11

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
import httpx

response = client.post(
    "/foo",
    cast_to=httpx.Response,
    body={"my_param": True},
)

print(response.headers.get("x-foo"))
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Checking for Null vs Missing Fields in Responses
DESCRIPTION: Example demonstrating how to differentiate between explicit null values and missing fields in API responses using model_fields_set.
SOURCE: https://github.com/retellai/retell-python-sdk/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-20_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
if response.my_field is None:
  if 'my_field' not in response.model_fields_set:
    print('Got json like {}, without a "my_field" key present at all.')
  else:
    print('Got json like {"my_field": null}.')
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Determining Installed Version of Retell SDK in Python
DESCRIPTION: Provides a code snippet to check the installed version of the Retell SDK at runtime, useful for troubleshooting and ensuring the correct version is being used.
SOURCE: https://github.com/retellai/retell-python-sdk/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-20_snippet_15

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
import retell
print(retell.__version__)
```

TITLE: Activating Virtual Environment
DESCRIPTION: Commands for activating the virtual environment either through Rye shell or manual activation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/retellai/retell-python-sdk/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-20_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
$ rye shell
# or manually activate - https://docs.python.org/3/library/venv.html#how-venvs-work
$ source .venv/bin/activate

# now you can omit the `rye run` prefix
$ python script.py
```

TITLE: Displaying Git Commit Hash in Markdown
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to reference a Git commit hash in a markdown changelog entry. This is used to link to specific commits that implemented features or fixes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/retellai/retell-python-sdk/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-20_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
([998682e](https://github.com/RetellAI/retell-python-sdk/commit/998682efa7001dd318cb372cf4311cd70a7179d3))
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Displaying Version Comparison Link in Markdown
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to create a link to compare two versions of the repository on GitHub. This is used to provide a full changelog between specific versions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/retellai/retell-python-sdk/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-20_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
[v4.3.0...v4.4.0](https://github.com/RetellAI/retell-python-sdk/compare/v4.3.0...v4.4.0)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Referencing GitHub Issue in Markdown
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to link to a GitHub issue in a markdown changelog entry. This is used to provide context for changes by referencing the related issue.
SOURCE: https://github.com/retellai/retell-python-sdk/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-20_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
([#176](https://github.com/RetellAI/retell-python-sdk/issues/176))
```

TITLE: Documenting Chores in Markdown
DESCRIPTION: This snippet lists the chores performed on the Retell Python SDK, including going live with a reference to an issue.
SOURCE: https://github.com/retellai/retell-python-sdk/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-20_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: Markdown
CODE:
```
### Chores

* go live ([#2](https://github.com/RetellAI/retell-python-sdk/issues/2)) ([a7ea29d](https://github.com/RetellAI/retell-python-sdk/commit/a7ea29d9d2c2680bed319eed192094f22f1265ad))
```
